intro: Verbascum salviifolium, commonly known as the Salvia-leaved mullein, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, velvety leaves. The plant produces showy yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or dry habitats. Verbascum salviifolium is valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional medicinal uses.
